meanings.definition: A governor of a province in ancient Rome
meanings.sent1: The proconsuls were responsible for overseeing the regions in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: During the Roman Empire, proconsuls were appointed to manage different territories.
meanings.sent3: The proconsuls in ancient Rome must have had to deal with a lot of paperwork!
meanings.sent4: In the history books, the proconsuls were like the CEOs of the Roman provinces.
meanings.sent5: The proconsuls wore distinguished robes to signify their authority over the provinces.
